sentences.sContent: A University of Muenster team drew up a marsupial family tree based on DNA.
sentences.sContent_eng: A University of Muenster team drew up a marsupial family tree based on DNA.
sentences.sCn: 明斯特的一所大学的研究小组构建了一株有袋类动物家族的DNA基因树图谱。

sentences.sContent: Wallabies are marsupial mammals like kangaroos and eat diets high in vegetation.
sentences.sContent_eng: Wallabies are marsupial mammals like kangaroos and eat diets high in vegetation.
sentences.sCn: 小袋鼠是像袋鼠一样有袋的哺乳类动物并食用含有大量制备的食物。

sentences.sContent: Commonly known as the Tasmanian Tiger, the Thylacine was the largest known carnivorous marsupial of modern times.
sentences.sContent_eng: Commonly known as the Tasmanian Tiger, the Thylacine was the largest known carnivorous marsupial of modern times.
sentences.sCn: 袋狼以塔斯马尼亚虎知名，它是现代社会最知名的食肉有袋动物。

trans.tranOther: an animal such as a  kangaroo  which carries its babies in a pocket of skin on its body
